intro: Androsace nortonii, commonly known as Norton's rock jasmine, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and alpine habitats.
